A few things to debunk this video:
1. As others have already pointed out, the must-connect feature has been 
removed completely.
But, most importantly:
2. The Kinect 2.0 device does not include any IR sensor of any kind. 
Informed viewers will note that the recorded video from the Kinect at 0:25 
is a software generated 3D space, reconstructing the real space based on 
the two HD cameras on the device, in real time. All clothing information, 
as well as background objects can be seen. If this were infrared, none of 
the "cold" objects in the scene would be visible. Compare to the TSA 
imagery from the real IR scan to see this clearly. The "dong" in the Kinect 
capture is likely a fold in the poor boy's pants.
What we can learn from this video: Don't trust everything you see on 
YouTube, and don't dance in front of the Kinect with a hard-on.﻿
